etymologies: late Middle English: from pro-‘on behalf of’, + noun, suggested by French pronom, Latin pronomen (from pro- ‘for, in place of’ + nomen ‘name’)

definitions: a word that can function by itself as a noun phrase and that refers either to the participants in the discourse (e.g., I, you) or to someone or something mentioned elsewhere in the discourse (e.g., she, it, this).
shortDefinitions: word that can function as noun phrase used by itself and that refers either to participants in discourse
